newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India gains amid demand, Bombay seen up.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India gains amid demand, Bombay seen up.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts ended firmer amid late demand from U.S. and Far Eastern buyers on Thursday, traders said.
They said prices had picked up following a recent sluggish performance and after a market holiday in Bombay.
"We have seen selective interest from the Far East and U.S. which has pushed them through," a trader said.
He said the market was expecting a pick up in Indian stocks traded in Bombay when that market opened on Friday, possibly raising the index by 20 to 30 points.
"But we don't expect too many fireworks," he said.
Stocks in Delhi were firmer on Thursday.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed 0.79 points up at 78.46, with the premium over the local market at 20.06 percent from 18.94 percent.
SBI added 20 cents to $23.35/$24.35 and Bajaj Auto added 70 cents to $30.25/31.75.

Taiwanese GDRs tracked local stocks lower following strong gains on Wednesday, with the Capel Taiwan GDR Index down 1.43 points, or 1.14 percent, to 123.76, representing a discount to the local market of 2.58 percent.
The Capel Korea GDR Index added 0.15 points to 60.82 points, a premium of 33.26 percent over the local market.
